messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] need advice/reassurance
messages.msgSnippet: on 4/1/05 9:59 AM, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com at ... And, in my experience, they re extremely suspicious that it s a trickbecause frequently it is!
messages.messageBody:
on 4/1/05 9:59 AM, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com at
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> This is exactly my experience, too. And they're often extremely
> suspicious that it is a trick - that, in fact, their grade is going to
> depend, not on how well they argue their own position, but on how well
> they guess my opinion and spout it.
>
> -pam


And, in my experience, they're extremely suspicious that it's a trickbecause
frequently it is!

On a slightly related subject: My husband has a wonderful story of taking a
symbolic logic class and finding a mistake in something on the board. The
professor denied it, then other students chimed in, agreeing that there was
an error. My husband didn't do very well in the class or with that professor
in the future (he had planned on being a philosophy major) and it turns out
that the mistake on the board had been a key part of the professor's
dissertation.

Kathleen
in Culver City
